The Orc '''Berserker''' was a concept developed for [[Peter Jackson]]'s film ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]''. The Berserkers are portrayed as a [[Wikipedia:Juggernaut
column3: Uruk]] of [[Saruman]] with a great two-handed sword. They wear no armor apart from a helmet, and, according to the [[Weta Workshop]] designers, they fill it with blood before placing them on their heads and charging into battle, developing a blood-lust.{{fact}}

column1: Berserker orcs also appear in ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]'', although this time they are a type of [[Mount Gundabad
column2: Gundabad Orcs]]. They were part of [[Bolg]]'s second Orc army, and are apparently stronger than the average Gundabad Orc, with some coming close to killing [[Thorin Oakenshield]]. Unlike the Uruk berserkers, they wear armor, with some having articulated breastplates resembling faces<ref>The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies art and design, page 206</ref>
